qas.question: The electrical properties of neurons are controlled by what?

answers.text: neurotransmitters and receptors that take place at synapses

qas.question: What type of signals do neurons transfer from one another?

context: The functions of the brain depend on the ability of neurons to transmit <a1_0>electrochemical<a1_0/> signals to other cells, and their ability to respond appropriately to electrochemical signals received from other cells. The electrical properties of neurons are controlled by a wide variety of biochemical and metabolic processes, most notably the interactions between <a0_0>neurotransmitters and receptors that take place at synapses<a0_0/>.
